intro: Centaurium majus subsp. rhodense, commonly known as the red-centaury, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Gentianaceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pinkish-red. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils in mountainous regions of Europe. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slight hairy texture. It is valued in traditional herbal medicine for its potential medicinal properties.
